Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the state will have the highest general revenue in state history next year, without considering inflation-adjusted figures.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that conservative pro-growth policies are solely responsible for the increase in general revenue.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in general revenue is solely due to conservative pro-growth policies, ignoring other factors and national trends.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the increase in general revenue, such as economic growth or changes in tax policies.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that revenue projections for 2014-15 are not a record when adjusted for inflation.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that revenues in previous fiscal years, when adjusted for inflation, were higher than the projected revenues for 2014-15.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not acknowledging the role of other legs of the state budget, such as trust funds and federal funding, in overall revenue.
